Purpose: Practice the fundamental VAT calculation that underpins all VAT compliance work: converting between net and gross amounts and isolating the VAT element. Learners understand how VAT is added to prices and how to extract VAT from VAT-inclusive amounts.
Inputs: Amount (number) | VAT rate (percentage) | Calculation direction: either 'Add VAT to net amount' or 'Extract VAT from gross amount'
Outputs: Net amount | VAT amount | Gross amount | Calculation breakdown showing the formula used
User_Flow: 1. User selects calculation direction: 'Add VAT to net amount' or 'Extract VAT from gross amount'. 2. User enters the amount (net or gross depending on direction selected). 3. User enters the VAT rate as a percentage. 4. User clicks 'Calculate'. 5. Results panel displays: net amount and gross amount and VAT amount and the formula used (e.g. 'Net £100 × 20% = £20 VAT'). 6. User can click 'Clear' to reset all fields and start a new calculation.
Limitations: Does NOT: determine which VAT rate applies to a supply | validate whether VAT should be charged | handle multiple rates in one calculation | connect to any tax authority system | store or track transactions | generate returns or compliance reports. User must know the applicable rate before using this tool.

Purpose: Practice calculating the Effective Tax Rate (ETR) for a jurisdiction under GloBE Rules. Learners understand how GloBE Income and Adjusted Covered Taxes combine to determine whether a jurisdiction is low-taxed (ETR below 15%).
Inputs: GloBE Income (currency amount) | Adjusted Covered Taxes (currency amount) | Jurisdiction name (text - optional for display)
Outputs: Jurisdictional ETR (percentage to 4 decimal places) | Top-up Tax Percentage (15% minus ETR or 0 if ETR >= 15%) | Status indicator (Low-Taxed Jurisdiction or Compliant) | Calculation breakdown showing formula
User_Flow: 1. User enters GloBE Income amount. 2. User enters Adjusted Covered Taxes amount. 3. User optionally enters jurisdiction name for reference. 4. User clicks 'Calculate ETR'. 5. Results panel displays: ETR percentage | Top-up Tax Percentage | Status (red if low-taxed or green if compliant) | Formula breakdown. 6. User can click 'Clear' to reset.
Data_Required: None - user provides values from case study
Limitations: Does NOT: perform GloBE Income adjustments | calculate Adjusted Covered Taxes from components | handle negative GloBE Income scenarios | connect to any tax system | validate data accuracy | generate actual GIR filings. This is for learning the ETR calculation only.
Used_By: GloBE Information Return: Complete Filing Implementation

Outputs: Payroll Carve-out Rate (based on fiscal year) | Payroll SBIE Amount | Asset Carve-out Rate (based on fiscal year) | Asset SBIE Amount | Total SBIE | Calculation breakdown
User_Flow: 1. User selects Fiscal Year from dropdown (rates vary by year during transition). 2. User enters Eligible Payroll Costs. 3. User enters Eligible Tangible Assets (Net Book Value). 4. User clicks 'Calculate SBIE'. 5. Results panel displays: applicable rates for selected year | Payroll SBIE calculation | Asset SBIE calculation | Total SBIE | Formula breakdown. 6. User can click 'Clear' to reset.
Data_Required: None - user provides values from case study
Limitations: Does NOT: determine which payroll costs are eligible | calculate tangible asset NBV | validate asset location requirements | handle SBIE for PEs or JVs | connect to any tax system. User must know eligible amounts before using this tool.
Used_By: GloBE Information Return: Complete Filing Implementation

Purpose: Practice assessing whether a jurisdiction qualifies for the Transitional CbCR Safe Harbour. Learners understand the three tests (De Minimis and Simplified ETR and Routine Profits) and which jurisdictions require full GloBE calculations.
Inputs: Fiscal Year (dropdown: 2024-2026) | CbCR Revenue (currency) | CbCR Profit Before Tax (currency) | Simplified Covered Taxes (currency) | SBIE Amount (currency - for Routine Profits test)
Outputs: Test results for: De Minimis Test (Pass/Fail with thresholds) | Simplified ETR Test (Pass/Fail with calculated ETR vs threshold) | Routine Profits Test (Pass/Fail) | Overall Safe Harbour Status | Recommendation (Safe Harbour applies or Full GloBE calculation required)
User_Flow: 1. User selects Fiscal Year (ETR threshold varies: 15% for 2024 | 16% for 2025 | 17% for 2026). 2. User enters CbCR Revenue. 3. User enters CbCR Profit Before Tax. 4. User enters Simplified Covered Taxes. 5. User enters SBIE Amount. 6. User clicks 'Check Safe Harbour'. 7. Results panel displays: each test result with Pass/Fail and supporting calculation | Overall status | Clear recommendation. 8. User can click 'Clear' to reset.
Data_Required: None - user provides values from case study
Limitations: Does NOT: validate CbCR data quality | determine if CbCR is 'qualified' | handle QDMTT Safe Harbour | connect to any tax system | provide binding advice. This is for learning safe harbour assessment only. Professional judgment required for actual filings.
Used_By: GloBE Information Return: Complete Filing Implementation
